Okay - I have a thing I'm trying to track down. If any of you can help me, I'd really really appreciate it. Old books
When I was a tiny egg in the early 80s, I grew up in a little town in West Yorkshire. Went to the Church of England school until I was 11
Being obsessed with 2000AD and drawing all the time, I was always looking for cool sci-fi stuff, preferably illustrated.
They had a small library (pair of bookshelves in a corridor), and I used to read these amazing books about some sci-fi spies
I think they were old Penguin books. They used to have adventures (all set on earth). They had self-heating meals and things. Lots of robots
Can't remember much about them except really enjoying them. They were paperbacks and had several stories in them with same characters
They were a pair of blokes that were some sort of agents working for a futuristic organization that wold sent them off against some foe
Think they had flying cars too. Might have to try regressive hypnosis. Hate being vague on details. I do remember one cover
It was mostly white with a turquoise and black stripey robot on the right hand side coming at a man on the left
They were always getting surprise-attacked by reprogrammed domestic robots and stuff like that. Very exciting reading for a kid
@Wireless_Ade Good tip, cheers ;)
There's something else I'm even keener to track down and I can be more specific about this one. Also sci-fi I'm afraid
@benjiandblossom Sorry - that's not it. They were definitely "proper blokes" in the stories. Thanks for the effort though, appreciate it ;)
@Rob_McCallum They must have been 60s or 70s to end up in a school library in the 80s. Felt very 70s as I remember the cover art
Okay, the other one was a two series of books that each had their own box. One was red and one was a cyan colour. They were about Mars
They felt really old and were illustrated with black and while line drawings of a Chesley Bonestell sort of vibe. Pointy rockets, etc.
They used to drive around Mars in these buggies with stickey-out wheels like wooden toys. There were canals on Mars too
They were somewhat serialized and characters used to pop up in different books. Think they met aliens too. Lots of exploring
They had a real "Dan Dare" sort of vibe, but whilst attempting to make it feel more believable. Stories based around science stuff
@Vayshti Nice one, cheers ;)
Don't suppose that sets off any bells? They felt old back then - maybe 60s era. One of those things I could never get out of my mind
@Rob_McCallum If I find out I'll let you know ;)

So I just want to tell you a little story. It may take a few tweets, but I'm hoping you'll forgive me... November was a hell of a month!
On November 4th, my beautiful fiancé @rodeneronquillo & I were, frisking about in bed, as you do. I am a boob man & found... A lump.
It was a Sunday, so we had to wait to get an appointment to have the lump biopsied but by Wednesday, we had an answer. Cancer. Stage 2.
We were a little overwhelmed by the news: cancer & Election Day, so decided to make it a set, ran down to the courthouse & got married!
So cancer, election, marriage. All on one day! Two days later, Ro was in surgery.
Surgery went really well. Did what we had to do, & were put on a fast track to getting ready for chemo. Starts this coming Tuesday.
Lots has happened between nov 6 and now. Ro will be putting up a blog about what we've gone through, but the point is this...
I love my wife more than anyone. She's young as can be. Women are getting breast cancer younger & younger. Women? check yourselves! ..& men?

@Stevolutionary would give Chinese citizens work, and China resources Russia doesnt need.  But gives Russia cold, hard cash.
